question: 見付ける
sourceMnemonic:
You know that <ja>付ける</ja> means "to attach" and that <ja>見</ja> means "see." So, when you attach your seeing to something, it's like you're looking around trying <vocabulary>to find</vocabulary> something. When you find what you're looking for, imagine your eyeballs flying out and attaching to that item, then yelling "I FOUND IT!"

You'll usually see this word with the <ja>付</ja> in kana, so <ja>見つける</ja>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings come from <ja>見る</ja> and <ja>付ける</ja>. If you use those readings, you'll be able to read this word too.
